authors.author: Frederick W. Faber Henri F. Hemy

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Faith of our fathers, living still newline In spite of dungeon, fire and sword! newline O how our hearts beat high with joy newline Whene'er we hear that glorious word! newline Faith of our fathers! Holy faith! newline We will be true to Thee till death!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Our fathers, chained in prisons dark, newline Were still in heart and conscience free. newline How sweet would be their children's fate newline If they, like them could die for thee! newline Faith of our fathers! Holy faith! newline We will be true to Thee till death!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Faith of our fathers! God's great power newline Shall win all nations unto thee; newline And through the truth that comes from God newline Mankind shall then be truly free. newline Faith of our fathers! Holy faith! newline We will be true to thee till death!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Faith of our fathers we will love newline Both friend and foe in all our strife; newline And preach Thee, too, as love knows how, newline By kindly words and virtuous life. newline Faith of our fathers! Holy faith! newline We will be true to Thee till death!

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Faith of our fathers we will strive newline To win all nations unto Thee! newline And thro' the truth that comes from God newline Mankind shall then be truly free: newline Faith of our fathers! Holy faith! newline We will be true to Thee till death!
